a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Access to electricity, urban vs. rural, 2020
The definition used in international statistics adopts a very low cutoff for what it means to ‘have access to
electricity’. It is defined as having an electricity source that can provide very basic lighting, and charge a
phone or power a radio for 4 hours per day.
Access to electricity, rural (% of rural population)
Access to electricity, urban (% of urban population)
Data source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
